meanings.definition: An outer garment with sleeves, covering the upper part of the body.
meanings.sent1: She wore a warm coat to stay cozy in the cold weather.
meanings.sent2: The coat hung neatly on the rack by the door.
meanings.sent3: The coat danced in the wind as if it had a life of its own.
meanings.sent4: His kindness was like a comforting coat that shielded her from the harsh world.
meanings.sent5: The bright red coat stood out in the sea of black jackets.

meanings.definition: To cover with a layer of a particular substance.
meanings.sent1: Please coat the chicken with breadcrumbs before frying it.
meanings.sent2: The workers will coat the metal beams with a protective layer.
meanings.sent3: He decided to coat his car in a shiny, reflective paint for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to coat his heart with a layer of ice.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully coated the canvas with vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: A layer of a particular substance covering a surface.
meanings.sent1: The thick coat of paint on the walls gave the room a fresh look.
meanings.sent2: A coat of dust had settled on the old bookshelves.
meanings.sent3: The coat of chocolate on the strawberries made them irresistible.
meanings.sent4: The coat of snow blanketed the town in a peaceful silence.
meanings.sent5: The coat of varnish on the table made it shine in the sunlight.
